1) I‚Äôll post more later, but:

a) Crypto‚Äîand for that matter, commerce in general‚Äîdoes not function without peer to peer transfers and a presumption of freedom
b) it has to be free to write software as long as it is not eg a scam
c) validators‚Äô job is to validate not to police

Mainstream thinks crypto‚Äôs a scam.

How do we change this?

When prices go up too fast people get dumb.

But prices go down too fast people get dumb too.

I'm seeing a lot of dumb sentiment now.

"Crypto is useless"

"Crypto is a scam"

"GET REKT CRYPTO BROS LOL"

Noise.

Keep your head down and keep building.

Mark....6 months ago you were telling me crypto was the future and now your telling me not to buy it and its dead and a scam....

Have you been taking your wifes estrogen pills again?

It's okay you can tell me. https://t.co/QU7NWC1O58

Prepare for an all out psychological beat down.

Prepare to be shamed & shunned. To wake up to everyday to headlines calling crypto a scam.

Relentless attacks.

You‚Äôll feel very, very wrong. First, like you‚Äôre dumb. Then, like you‚Äôre crazy

This is what a crypto bear feels like.

Now crypto is a full on scam that never had any utility for the real world.

Narrative follows price.

Get ready for everyone to tell you crypto's a scam again.

Crypto critics: "100% of the industry is scams that create no value!"

Bitcoin Maximalists: "99.9% of the industry is scams that create no value!"

So close, yet so far...

BTW this includes a definite-optimist attitude to crypto. Hence my focus on:

* Public goods funding
* Social recovery / multisig wallets
* Reputation systems (could help a lot to fight scams!)
* PoS (solves energy issues)
* Scaling (reduces fees, makes non-financial apps viable)
A lot of scams in the crypto ecosystem simply prey on people who are bad at math.
Hey @YouTube check out all these crypto scams. https://t.co/uoM60smw4p
